Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, New York Board of Rabbis, 136 East 39th Street, New York, N.Y. 10016.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, New York Board of Rabbis, 136 East 39th Street, New York N.Y. 10016.



Council Member Garodnick moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 26, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Koslowitz moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 26, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 221 West Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 1, Application No. 20155746 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 221 West Broadway, Manhattan (20155746 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Menchaca:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 150188 PCK be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 4312 2nd Ave, Brooklyn (C 150188 PCK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Menchaca:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 150305 PCK be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 4312 2nd Ave, Brooklyn (C 150305 PCK)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulation of cooling towers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Regulation of cooling towers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring written communications regarding the results of inspections from the Departments of Consumer Affairs and Health and Mental Hygiene to be in the receiving business owner’s language of choice
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring written communications regarding the results of inspections from the Departments of Consumer Affairs and Health and Mental Hygiene to be in the receiving business owner’s language of choice.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on sex offenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Reporting on sex offenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on the implementation of next generation 911
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Reporting on the implementation of next generation 911.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a temporary task force to evaluate the epidemic of diabetes in the city of New York and recommend a comprehensive, citywide strategy to reduce the epidemic of diabetes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Creation of a temporary task force to evaluate the epidemic of diabetes in the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city plumbing code and the New York city building code, in relation to gender-neutral single-occupant bathrooms
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Gender-neutral single-occupant bathrooms.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon United States Food and Drug Administration to remove any blood donation restrictions based on sexual orientation
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: FDA to remove any blood donation restrictions based on sexual orientation.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an assessment of city managed court facilities to determine accessibility for persons with disabilities
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Assessment of city managed court facilities to determine accessibility for persons with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a carsharing parking pilot program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establishing a carsharing parking pilot program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to commuter vans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Commuter vans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the marketing of affordable housing units.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a monthly report to council members and community boards of certain permits issued by the department of buildings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring a monthly report to council members and community boards of certain permits issued by the department of buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring advertising and other materials pertaining to public events to include information regarding accessibility for people with disabilities.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring advertising and other materials pertaining to public events to include information regarding accessibility for people with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to receptacles in a building or dwelling that has a high concentration of rodent infestation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Receptacles in a building or dwelling that has a high concentration of rodent infestation.

Items.Title: A Local Law amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the installation of induction loops systems for certain capital projects paid in whole or in part from the city treasury and requiring the publication of public locations where such systems are available.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all public meetings be held in facilities equipped with assistive listening systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of disability service facilitators at city agencies

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Use of biodiesel fuel in school buses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Improving the Treatment of the U.S. Territories Under Federal Health Programs Act of 2015 (H.R. 2635), which would make improvements to the treatment of the United States territories under the Medicare and Medicaid programs
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Improving the Treatment of the U.S. Territories Under Federal Health Programs Act of 2015 (H.R. 2635)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring each community board to establish a veterans committee
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring each community board to establish a veterans committee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports on enforcement of right of way violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police dept to submit reports on enforcement of right of way violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a pilot program for the installation of dedicated left-turn arrow traffic signals at no fewer than 50 intersections in the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
